Definition: “Is the house pleasant, functional, and worth paying for?” Comfort, hygiene, basic quality-of-life.
Inputs: Baseline: Nutrition; Cleanliness. Dampeners: Crowding Pressure (high reduces); Maintenance Backlog (high reduces).
Suggested formula: Baseline × dampeners (multiplicative): \nLS = (Nutrition^wN × Cleanliness^wC) × ((1 − Crowding Pressure)^wCP) × ((1 − Maintenance Backlog)^wMB) \nStarter weights; wN 0.5; wC 0.5; wCP 0.35; wMB 0.35
Mechanic design commentary: Multiplicative dampening stops “compensation exploits”; players can’t brute-force one strong primitive to mask a structurally bad house. \nExponents as weights give you a single, intuitive tuning surface; raising a weight increases sensitivity to that factor without changing the overall shape. \nClamp to 0–1 at each stage keeps the metric stable; prevents edge cases from blowing up outcomes.
Direct effects (recruitment; churn; rent:
Rent tolerance: LS sets how much rent you can charge “safely”. 
rentTolerance = baseRent × (1 + rentScaleLS × LS) 
Over-rent pressure: overRent = max(0, (rent − rentTolerance) / rentTolerance) 
Churn: LS reduces churn directly; and reduces churn indirectly by raising rentTolerance. 
churnMultiplierLS = lerp(hiChurnLS, loChurnLS, LS) (example hi 1.6; lo 0.7)

Definition: “Is the house stable enough for people to work, recover, and stick around?” The long-term stability engine.
Inputs: Baseline: Drive. Dampeners: Noise (high reduces); Fatigue (high reduces); Crowding Pressure (high reduces); Low Nutrition (low reduces).
Suggested formula: Baseline × dampeners (multiplicative): \nPR = (Drive^wD) × ((1 − Fatigue)^wF) × ((1 − Noise)^wNO) × ((1 − Crowding Pressure)^wCP) × (Nutrition^wN) \nStarter weights; wD 1.0; wF 0.55; wNO 0.35; wCP 0.25; wN 0.25
Mechanic design commentary: Drive is necessary but not sufficient; the dampeners enforce the “can’t grind through chaos” fantasy. \nNoise double-edge: Noise improves Partytime a bit but harms PR; this naturally creates trade-offs without extra rules. \nClamp 0–1 makes PR comparable to LS and PT, and keeps churn scaling sane.
Direct effects (recruitment; churn; rent:
Churn: PR is the main “stay longer” lever, independent of rent strategy. 
churnMultiplierPR = lerp(hiChurnPR, loChurnPR, PR) (example hi 1.5; lo 0.75) 
Combined churn: churnRate = baseChurn × churnMultiplierLS × churnMultiplierPR × churnMultiplierRent 
Rent interaction: PR does not change rentTolerance; it changes whether residents tolerate the house over time.

Definition: “Is the house socially magnetic and fun?” Recruitment engine; creates attention and momentum.
Inputs: Baseline: Fun. Dampeners: Fatigue (high reduces); Low Nutrition (low reduces). Booster: Noise (minor positive).
Suggested formula:
Baseline × dampeners × capped booster: 
PT = (Fun^wFun) × ((1 − Fatigue)^wF) × (Nutrition^wN) × (1 + noiseBonus) 
noiseBonus = min(noiseBonusCap, noiseScale × Noise) 
Starter weights; wFun 1.0; wF 0.45; wN 0.25; noiseScale 0.08; noiseBonusCap 0.08
Mechanic design commentary: Minor positive Noise supports your “double-edged sword” intent; it helps recruiting vibes, but hurts PR. \nCap the Noise bonus to prevent “be loud for points” behaviour, while still letting noise matter. \nClamp 0–1 keeps invite scaling predictable.
Direct effects (recruitment; churn; rent:
Recruitment throughput: PT increases invite capacity per week. 
invitesPerWeek = baseInvites + floor(PT × inviteScale) (example baseInvites 1; inviteScale 3) 
Churn: no direct churn effect; churn happens via PR/LS and the underlying primitives (fatigue, noise). 
Rent: no direct effect.
